books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A tragic story of Jay Gatsby and his unrelenting love for Daisy Buchanan set against the backdrop of the Roaring Twenties.
books.authorBio: Chronicler of the Jazz Age whose lyrical prose captured the glamour and cost of the American Dream.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Scout Finch recounts her childhood in the Deep South as her father defends a Black man wrongly accused of a terrible crime.
books.authorBio: Pulitzer Prize–winning author celebrated for exploring justice, empathy, and moral courage in the American South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: Winston Smith wrestles with oppression in Oceania, a place where Big Brother watches everyone and independent thought is a crime.
books.authorBio: Essayist and novelist who warned about authoritarianism, surveillance, and the fragility of truth.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, manners, and misunderstandings in Regency-era England.
books.authorBio: Beloved Regency author renowned for her wit, social commentary, and keen observations of relationships.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: Holden Caulfield recounts his turbulent final days at Pencey Prep as he seeks authenticity and meaning.
books.authorBio: Reclusive voice of post-war adolescence whose work explores isolation, innocence, and authenticity.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: An orphaned boy discovers he is a wizard and begins his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
books.authorBio: Creator of the wizarding world whose imagination rekindled a global love for reading among young audiences.
authorTopBooks: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Bilbo Baggins joins a band of dwarves to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.
books.authorBio: Philologist and fantasy pioneer who built immersive worlds filled with lore, languages, and epic quests.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Fellowship forms to carry the One Ring to Mount Doom and destroy it before Sauron conquers Middle-earth.
books.authorBio: Philologist and fantasy pioneer who built immersive worlds filled with lore, languages, and epic quests.
